result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan M Arebalo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED - Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Credit for time served only to be used if revoked.
STAYED - Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Complete a mental health assessment and follow recommendations.

Maintain current recovery program. Counseling, treatment, services including Cognitive Therapy as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Pay all outstanding ZCI fees. Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant must serve 6 months with balance stayed. 
Huber granted for work, AA meetings and treatment. 
Defendant cannot report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

***MUST POST ADDITIONAL $500.00 BY 5:00 ON 8/15/14 OR REPORT TO RCJ.*** 
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Jury trial on December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
